column2: Silver Hand of Nuada

This ornate prosthetic hand is crafted from purest silver and covered in elaborate runes and filigree. According to legend, this is the very silver hand that was made by Creidnhe and attached by Dian Cecht to replace the great King Nuada's hand, lost in battle to the Fir Bolg champion Sreng.
Gae Assail

The spear of Lugh, Gae Assail is said to be "impossible to overcome" and that certain magic words could guarantee it would hit it's target when thrown and to have it return magically to the wielders hands.
Y Tair Tonnau

The Three Waves, the trident of Britannia. Britannic scripture says Britannia used Y Tair Tonnau to create the world out of the primordial ocean. The first prong raised the land from the depths, the second created the lakes and rivers, the third created life. The trident knows its true master is The Holy Mother, and will not give its tremendous powers to anyone else. Even without such powerful magic, The Three Waves is a formidable weapon.
Britannia's Helm
This Corinthian style helmet is covered in beautiful imagery of waves and clouds. Many say this is the helm of the Holy Mother herself.
Britannia's Shield

This large oval shield is made of bronze masterfully crafted onto a back of superb oak. The front bears an image of the white cliffs of Dover holding back a large wave. This shield is said to have been gifted to a mortal champion by Britannia herself.
Skull of Brigid

This plain skull is held in an ornate box that claims the contents to be the remains of none other than Brigid, considered a goddess by the Druids and a saint to Christians and Britannia's followers alike.
Horn of Bran Galed

According to legend, this ancient drinking horn belonged to Bran “The Stingy” Galed, and had the power to create any drink the holder desired. He was tricked out of it by Myrdinn, who secreted it away with the other 13 Treasures of Britain. In the intervening centuries it's been turned into a battle horn.
Tusk of Torc Triath
According to legend, this horn was created from the tusk of Torc Triath, King of the Boars. Torc Triath was hunted by King Arthur himself, aided by his loyal hunting hound Cabal.
Queen Boudicca's Torque

The main part of this golden torque is formed from 64 individual gold wires wound into 8 cords, which are then wound together again. Beautifully molded end-pieces feature swirls and horses. Allegedly, it once belonged to Boudicca, the warrior Queen of the Iceni people.
Ancient Carnyx

This ancient horn is subtly 's' shaped, the bell at the top shaped like a ferocious boar. Centuries ago the celtic tribes used these to communicate across the battlefield, the elevated position of the horn allowing the sound to travel far and wide.
Horned Helm
This helmet is centuries old, if not over a millenia. It was probably a prized posession of a Celtic tribal chief, but the strange horns look silly by modern standards.
Battersea Shield
This bronze tower shield is masterfully decorated. Pieces of colored enamel still cling to their fittings even after centuries at the bottom of a river.
Crown of Oak
The sacred crown worn by the reigning Myrdinn, head of the Druidic faith.
Torque of Splendour
Images of mighty beasts holding rubies, emeralds and sapphires decorate this masterpiece of goldsmithing.
Torque of Splendour
Images of mighty beasts holding rubies, emeralds and sapphires decorate this masterpiece of goldsmithing.
Burning Torque
Masterfully crafted, this torque is of finest gold twisted into a beautiful flowing loop, arcs of flame made of opals, tigers-eye and rubies emerging here and there from between the coils.
Torque of the Silvery Moon
This open loop of silver is decorated with small diamonds embedded in the twisted strands. Each diamond represents a different phase of the moon.
Immortal Head
Immortal Head of [Prev.GetBestName]
[PrevPrev.GetTitledName], apparently, defeated this immortal [This.GetManWoman] in a duel to the death. The head still speaks, giving advice to it's owner. Or so it is said.
Glorious Head
Glorious Head of [Prev.GetDynName]

The head of [Prev.GetTitledNameWithNick], slain in personal combat by [Prev.GetTitledNameWithNick]. The [This.GetManWoman] to convince the world that they are the direct descendant of Alexander the Great himself, [Prev.GetHerHis] head is a worthy trophy for any [PrevPrev.Religion.GetAdjective] warrior.
Glorious Head of Charlemagne
The preserved head of Charlemagne, patriarch of the Karling dynasty and first Holy Roman Emperor. Truly a worthy foe.
Honored Head
Honored Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]

A vessel containing the preserved head of [Prev.GetDynName], [Prev.GetTitle] of [Prev.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. Defeated in battle by [PrevPrev.GetBestName], who took their head to commemorate the victory.
Imperious Head
Imperious Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
The preserved head of [Prev.GetBestName], a claimant to the title of true Roman successor.
August Head
August Head of [Prev.GetDynName]
In this vessel is the head of a true Roman Emperor. A worthy trophy for any [PrevPrev.Religion.GetAdjective] warrior.
Head of The Conqueror
William the Conqueror, once the Duke of Normandy, then a King. An able warrior and leader of men. An honorable trophy for any warrior.
Exalted Head
Exalted Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
This head once belonged to [Prev.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], an exceptionally famous and respected individual, [Prev.GetSheHe] as exalted among men.
Sanctified Head
Sanctified Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
[Prev.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] was an exceptionally pious individual, a paragon of [Prev.Religion.GetAdjective] virtue. Now [Prev.GetHerHis] head honors it's owner as a trophy.
Purpleborn Head
Purpleborn Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
This is the preserved head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], who was "porphyrogenitos" or "born in the purple", a prestigous status in the Byzantine court.
Prestigous Head
Prestigous Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
The preserved head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], a character of some renown.
Pious Head
Pious Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
The preserved head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], a pious [Prev.Religion.GetAdherentName].
Head
Head of [Prev.GetTitledFirstName]
The preserved head of an unremarkable individual. Evidently they were accomplished enough to warrant a trophy, but history has not bothered to remember why.
Nimean Lionskin

This hooded cloak has been made from the hide of a large, black-maned lion. The skull has been fitted with a padded leather cap to serve as a helm. Many believe this to be the Nimean Lion's skin, the very hide worn by Heracles during his final 11 labors.
Kronium

This large, uncut ruby is dark and lumpy, with sharp edges here and there. It gives the general impression of a scab or blood clot. Perhaps this is why the gem is believed to be the blood of Kronos, shed from wounds endured in the Titanomachy and crystalized over the millenia. No one knows how many of these stones exist, but they are greatly prized by the titan's worshippers.
Bloody Robes of Caesar

This bloodstained toga is said to be the very same one worn by Gaius Julius Caesar the day he was assassinated. Caesar was deified after his death, making these robes one of the holiest objects in Roman religion.
Aethonian Feather

This huge reddish-brown feather is said to have come from the great eagle, Aethon, that tormented Prometheus by eating his liver every day for 30,000 years. Prometheans are, understandably, offended by its very existence.
Achilles Shield
The shield given to Achilles by Hephaestus, at the bidding of his mother Thetis. It has been reforged from fragments and is a splendid piece of craftsmanship.
Hector's Armor

A breastplate of hardened, oil-brushed bronze fitted to well-made leather armor. A large Iota embossed on the front in gold declares allegiance to Ilium. This armor is believed to be that worn by Hector. As told in The Iliad it was taken by Achilles after he defeated Hector, and until now it was lost to history.
Odysseus' Bow

This large, black recurve bow is made of many layers of horn glued together. The curve is more dramatic than normal, requiring tremendous strength to string and draw. This has been taken to mean it is the bow of Odysseus himself, the legendary hero of The Odyssey.
Death Mask of Agamemnon
This golden mask adorned the head of Agamemnon's coffin.
Crown of Theseus
This circlet of white gold and blue sapphires is said to have belonged to Theseus, the mythical founder of Athens.
Skull of Alexander the Great
This skull is believed to be the only surviving remains of Alexander the Great, secreted away from his tomb in Alexandria by devoted worshipers during a siege.
Alexander the Great's Armor

This breastplate encompasses form and function in one. Beautifully made and strong, it is well-suited for a warrior king wishing to leave an impression of grandeur. No one is sure when it was separated from his body, nor how it ended up where it was found.
Golden Amphora
This ancient amphora is made of high quality gold. It is said to bring prosperity to its owner.
Sphinx Claw
A huge claw, jet-black and incredibly sharp. Said to be from the paw of a sphinx slain by some hero in ancient times.
Golden Apple

An apple made of solid gold. Some say that the cursed touch of King Midas created this apple. Others say that it is the Apple of Discord which Eris threw onto Olympus, ultimately leading to the Trojan War.
Corinthian Helm
An ancient relic, this helm belonged to a great warrior or prince.
Petrified Tongue of an Oracle
A small stone said to be the petrified tongue of an ancient oracle. The power of the oracle is supposed to sharpen the tongue of the one who holds this artifact.
Silver Amphora
A beautiful amphora made from fine silver and decorated with reliefs of humans and satyrs celebrating a bountiful harvest at the feet of Demeter.
Shard of Achilles Shield
This shard of metal bares reliefs of battle scenes that match the descriptions of Achilles shield from The Illiad. Perhaps if you found more...
Crown of Upper and Lower Egypt
The sacred crown worn by the reigning Pharoah, head of the Kemetic faith.
Sunburst Crown
The sacred crown worn by the reigning Meryaten, head of the Atenic faith.

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary within which lies a skull. This skull, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, is none other than that of St Brigid of Kildare!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box, within which lies an ornately engraved hand made of silver. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the hand that was forged for Nuada after he lost his real one in battle!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a beautiful trident decorated with ocean motifs. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Y Tair Tonnau "The Three Waves", the very trident Britannia used to create the world!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a leather bag, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an ornate corinthian helm. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the blessed helm of Britannia!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large object wrapped in furs, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a large shield emblazoned with the crest of The Holy Mother. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the holy Shield of Britannia!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a gilded horn with images of flowing ale on it's sides. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Horn of Bran Galed!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an ivory horn engraved with images of mighty warriors locked in battle with a titanic boar. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Tusk of Torc Triath!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a golden torque formed from many gold wires wound together. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Torque of Boudicca, warrior queen of the Iceni!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large object wrapped in leathers, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a long battle horn ending in the open mouth of a bronze boar. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a Carnyx battle horn used by ancient warriors!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an iron helm with strange, large horns. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the helm of an ancient celtic warrior prince!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a huge chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a bronze tower shield beautifully embossed and decorated with red enamel. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a blessed shield that belonged to an ancient druid!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls the skin of a lion with a jet black mane. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the skin of the Nimean Lion!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a large, red, uncut gem. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the crystalized blood of Kronos, shed in the Titanomachy and known as Kronium!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a bloody toga. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the very robes Caesar wore whe he was assassinated!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be an impossibly large eagle's feather. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a feather from the titanic eagle Aethon!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be a piece of a shattered shield. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a fragmet from the shield of Achilles!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a black and gold breastplate. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Hector of Troy's breastplate!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be a large, thick recurve bow. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the bow of the great hero Odysseus!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a thin gold mask. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the death mask of Agamemnon!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a silver circlet set with sapphires. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the crown of Theseus, founder of Athens!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an ancient looking skull. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the last known remains of Alexander the Great!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a set of ancient looking bronze armor. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Alexander the Great's armor!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an amphora of pure gold. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a Golden Amphora, blessed by the gods!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a silk bag, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a huge black claw. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a claw from the sphinx that Oedipus defeated in a battle of wits!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a golden apple. This, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, was created by the cursed touch of Midas!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a helm in the style of ancient Corinth. This, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, once belonged to a great king!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a small oblong stone. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the petrified tongue of an ancient oracle!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an amphora of pure silver. This amphora is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, blessed by Demeter!
